name: Pork Sausage Apple Stuffing in Pancetta Cups (Muffin Tin)
description: Stuffing baked in pancetta cups! The stuffing is slightly adapted from this Pork Sausage Dressing recipe by Hapa Nom Nom. These are fantastic made on the day but even better the day after because the flavours meld together even more. They reheat very well in the oven - both the pancetta and the tops crisp up again in the oven.
recipeIngredient: 16 slices of pancetta (, around 12cm/5" in diameter (so it fits the muffin tin nicely))
1 lb / 500g   Italian pork sausage (, casings removed (Note 1))
1  granny smith apple (, skin on, finely chopped)
1/3 cup almonds (, roughly chopped (note: original recipe called for pecans which I didn't have))
5 cups slightly stale white bread (, cut into 1/3" / 1cm cubes (Notes 2 & 3))
1 tsp fresh sage (, finely chopped (or 1/2 tsp dried sage))
1 tsp fresh thyme (, finely chopped (or 1/2 tsp dried thyme))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350F/180C with the oven rack in the middle.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350F/180C with the oven rack in the middle.

recipeInstructions.text: Get 2 muffin trays and partially stack them so you have 16 muffin holes and the "joined" muffin tins will fit on one shelf (Note 4).
recipeInstructions.name: Get 2 muffin trays and partially stack them so you have 16 muffin holes and the "joined" muffin tins will fit on one shelf (Note 4).

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large fry pan over high heat. Add the pork sausage and cook it, breaking up the meat as you go. Cook until the sausage changes from pink to light brown and some of the bits starts to brown - about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large fry pan over high heat. Add the pork sausage and cook it, breaking up the meat as you go. Cook until the sausage changes from pink to light brown and some of the bits starts to brown - about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the sausage into a bowl and drain the excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the sausage into a bowl and drain the excess fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Return the pan to the stove and reduce the heat to medium high. Add the butter, and once melted, add the onion and celery. Sauté for around 3 minutes until the onion is translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Return the pan to the stove and reduce the heat to medium high. Add the butter, and once melted, add the onion and celery. Sauté for around 3 minutes until the onion is translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the apple and almonds, and cook, stirring occasionally, for another 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the apple and almonds, and cook, stirring occasionally, for another 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the fry pan from the stove. Add the bread and gently stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the fry pan from the stove. Add the bread and gently stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken stock/broth, cream, sage and thyme and sit to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chicken stock/broth, cream, sage and thyme and sit to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the egg and stir until mixed through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the egg and stir until mixed through.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the mixture between the 16 pancetta cups.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the mixture between the 16 pancetta cups.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the top is golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the top is golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven and let them rest for 10 minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven and let them rest for 10 minutes before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: To make ahead, transfer to a cooling rack. Cover and refrigerate until required. Then reheat in a 180C/350C preheated oven for 5 to 10 minutes until the pancetta and top is crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: To make ahead, transfer to a cooling rack. Cover and refrigerate until required. Then reheat in a 180C/350C preheated oven for 5 to 10 minutes until the pancetta and top is crispy.

review.reviewBody: I have made this recipe several times and love it!!!  This year I want to change it up a bit and was wondering if you think mushrooms instead of sausage would be okay?

BEST THANKSGIVING MEAL EVER!

I made your Juicy Slow Cooker Turkey Breast last year for Thanksgiving (wonderful and juicy!) and this year we decided to bake a ham,  so I quickly searched your site and found your Maple Glazed Ham and this wonderful stuffing recipe.  According to my wife, this was the BEST Thanksgiving MEAL she has EVER HAD!

The only issue I ran into was the pancetta I bought turned out to be so fatty that the fat/oil bubbled out of the muffin tin on to the bottom of my oven, but you know what they say....fat = flavor.  And yes, the stuffing muffins are even better tasting the next day. Next year I'll make them a day in advance.

Thanks again for making our Thanksgiving such a success :)
